channel.title: Notes on Mike Brave
channel.description: Recent content in Notes on Mike Brave

item.title: A Theory Of Happiness
item.description: A Definition What Makes People Happy? Mastery - Being good at what you do, competence Belonging - Social relationships Autonomy - Freedom to make decisions Needs satisfied Happiness is independent of outcomes but we allow our feelings about outcomes to direct it

item.title: Attitudes That Help You Grow In A Happier Direction
item.description: Inviting the World To Play With You How to play, everything is play The Homeless Guy In Austin About overcoming fear of Dancing “I Play with you, You Play With Me” Creating sandboxes to play in, the Wisdom of Teagan Humility is a Willingness To Learn, an Openness On Gratitude, The Seed of Happiness We never achieve things ourselves, we are just a piece of that achievement, your parents raised you, your friends supported you, your society shaped you, you are the core piece, but only a piece, respect and give credit, let them share your accomplishments and achievements because it is theirs too.

item.title: Awe, Wonder & Pleasant Surprises
item.description: Embracing and Encouraging Surprise and wonder in our lives What is Delight? Find Joy in the unexpected “Oh that’s interesting” “I never would have thought of that”

item.title: Being Practical Is The Act Of Seeing Through Illusions
item.description: Instead of buying into the culture/media you can see it as it is But if you go too far off the path of normal you will be considered insane Beware of Tinfoil Hat Conspiracy Theories, usually the bigger the theory the less true it is.

item.title: Big Picture Thinking
item.description: What Actually Matters? The shortness of life - the many ways life could end, the many ways the world could How Warren’s car crash made him quit sweating the small stuff, and made his life better The ability to die, fragility and a shelf life is what allows ethics? Love is worth fighting for. Easing the suffering of others is worth fighting for. The small and tender moments are worth giving everything else up for, don’t be a workaholic

item.title: Changing Moralities and The Shifting of Self
item.description: Morality Is A Kind Of Cowardice, A Conscience Makes Cowards Of Us All But that isn’t something to look down on, just something to be aware of “I Don’t Want That Anymore” - Ambitions Change With Life The tempering of ambitions and how we shift as people Parents changing direction of what they want to new goals that include or feature their children, it’s not wrong, but it is kinda unexpected

item.title: Difficult Truths And How To Accept Them
item.description: If it Pisses You Off, There’s a Bit Of Truth in it, Usually… It hits hard because you know you should have taken care of it already A hard truth that needs to be faced This isn’t always true as sometimes it’s just ridiculous that they even suggest it and it’s angering because of how defamatory it is, but if it was truly ridiculous you would probably laugh instead of getting angry.

item.title: Helpful Strategies And Techniques For A Happier Life
item.description: Forgiving Yourself, Forgiving The World I am weak willed at times, be forgiving to yourself Everyone else is just as human as you are, be kind to them. The buddhist idea that life is suffering, so be kind We all kind of suck so be kind to yourself Humanity Is Having Compassion And Suffering With Someone Life Will Provide, You Need Very Little To Live During the camino, people came and went, things sorted themselves out, what you needed was enough, life provided, wisdom was all around, beauty in unlikely places.

item.title: How People Are
item.description: Our Flaws Make Us Better - Why It’s Ok for Smart People to Do Dumb Things I’m always shocked when people I admire do dumb things, but never when I do. I don’t even look down on them, it’s just an “oh, that’s odd”. We are all just human. It’s better this way Art Shapes Our Values - Our Surroundings Influence Us Example - Having Flowers at a school, changes how the school is, how the students treat it and how much learning can take place there

item.title: Live An Interesting Life
item.description: Say Yes as Often as You Can Always Choose The Better Story What You Want To Do Is Cheaper Than You Think, Find a Way

item.title: Magic Is All Around Us, We Just Don’t See It
item.description: We Often Don’t See Because We Don’t Know How To See Yet The Hippies Were Right - Undiscovered Things That Matter & Influence There Is Value In Stating The Obvious Common Sense is a Lie The Problem Isn’t The Problem We Think It Is - i.e. Piracy Is About Service, Not Cost How a Thing Is Communicated Isn’t The Thing Itself The subject and how it’s communicated, often grouped together, not actually the same thing

item.title: Nothing Exists In A Vacuum
item.description: Everything is Connected, Ecosystems Within Ecosystems Your body and your mind aren’t separate, similarly your cells and bacteria are part of you too Dependencies and Chain Reactions Network Effects Sometimes a thing by itself won’t do anything, but combined with the right something else will create extraordinary results. Thinking With Systems A business is a collection of systems, usually ran by people

item.title: Pain Isn’t Antagonistic to Happiness, But it’s Easier to Be Happy When Pain is Managed
item.description: Non-Attachment and Letting Go - Our Expectations are the Painful Part Goodbyes as an Act of Love - Ash and freeing his pokemon, because he really cared about them You can’t trust anything to be there tomorrow, people leave or die, currency loses value, governments fail, websites disappear Every freedom we have could one day disappear, it has happened before, vigilance and care, and a long memory are required to keep it.

item.title: Tragedy, Loss and Hope
item.description: Tragedy and Loss Should Be Treated As the Catalysts of Choice, Show Your Cards or Don’t It reframes the conflict, now it’s real The reframing loss/death These are moments given to us to now choose a path, there is pain, but there is also options of play, we always have some choice to make. Tragedy is When Poor Choices Are Made, and Consequences Cascade From it Loss Due to Poor Behavior Feels Like Justice - But it Isn’t

item.title: Truly Living
item.description: The Point Of The Game Is To Keep Playing, To Play a Beautiful Game Leap Before You Look - Stop Living a Sterile Life Avoiding Pain Is Keeping Me From Living A ship is safe on the docks but that’s not what ships are for. Inventiveness, Playfulness and Living There is no reason it can’t be fun Life Is Resource Management (see boxing) Really Living vs Being Responsible A good story doesn’t start with “so I followed the rules and was truly safe”
